Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around 2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel..

programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Attenborough's Living Lights
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jim investigates the murders of a Glasgow by-election candidate and her agent, who had been championing the return of capital punishment. However, the veteran detective finds himself hard-pressed to arrive at a quick solution to the crime. Elsewhere, a young woman is strangled by her stalker then raped. Robert Carlyle makes one of his earliest screen appearances, alongside star Mark McManusrs.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Legal action against Larry Cotter proves fruitless, so the sisters decide to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor comes up against the governors of the East London Hospital when they threaten to take over the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The sleuthing monk defends a man accused of murdering a wealthy and powerful baron, with only a mysterious leper as his ally. Medieval drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Terence Hardiman, Michael Culver and Sarah Badel.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The police suspect Lovejoy of stealing from one of Jane's old friends, forcing him to enlist the help of refuse collector extraordinaire Brian Nun to clear himself. Unfortunately, matters are complicated by Eric's 'bin diving' habit. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Two mysterious murders appear to be the work of an ancient Mayan curse attached to a statue acquired by Lovejoy. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: General Wellesley receives unwanted reinforcements from the King of Spain in the form of the Royal Irish Company and Sharpe is charged with transforming them into an effective fighting unit. When Kiely learns his wife is pregnant, he sends her away out of harm's way, but she is captured. With Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Hugh Fraser.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz finds himself back in England after a night of heavy drinking - but has no idea how he got there. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A spate of petty pilfering in the hut leads to fears that one of the lads may be a thief - and prompts Oz to come up with a novel way of catching the culprit. Classic comedy, starring Kevin Whately, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Long Black Coat
programme.desc: Victor's continuing campaign against bureaucrats finds another victim - a health and safety inspector who comes to check on the compost heap at the bottom of the Meldrews' allotment. Christmas special from 1991, with guest star Eric Idle.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The grand opening of Pryde Castle ends in disaster when a guide is struck by an arrow, and Father Brown becomes convinced that the motive lies buried in the Pryde family's past. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

credits.actor: Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Convicted killer Violet is given a temporary reprieve from the gallows, and begs Father Brown to help prove her innocence. However, with only three days in which to do it, he must try to find the real culprit before it's too late. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: As the Brokenwood Golf Club gathers for its Wednesday morning round, a zombie-like figure lurches from the morning mist identified as Alison Stone, the wealthy club owner. Her face red and blistering, she collapses into a bunker and dies leaving Mike and Kristin to investigate an apparent homicide by poisoning. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The Murdochs' housewarming party is cut short when a man is cooked to the point of exploding in a closet-sized microwave prototype. Return of the crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a magician's assistant is killed, Frankie goes undercover to find the culprit. But can she see clearly through the smoke and mirrors?.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Anna Westin, a troubled childhood friend of Wallander's daughter, visits his house late at night begging for his help - but disappears soon afterwards. Meanwhile, an elderly woman's burned body is found in a shallow grave, and when the detective discovers a connection between Anna and the murder victim, he fears she could be the next target of a dangerous religious fanatic. Linda returns to Ystad to help with the investigation, and has life-changing news for her father. Guest starring Lindsay Duncan (Rome), with Kenneth Branagh and Jeany Spark.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian struggles to control his urge to drink and finds refuge in a commune at the centre of the team's investigation into the death of a university student. The case also helps Gerry to face up to his relationship with Emily - who has not spoken to him since she discovered the truth about the DNA test at Ricky Hanson's trial. Police drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The doctor is summoned by farmer's wife Mrs Henderson, who presents him with a puzzling case to solve involving her son, while Dr Cameron moves to his country cottage.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young's funeral casts a sombre shadow over Sun Hill as the team gather to pay their last respects to their colleague, but any hopes of a dignified send-off are dashed by an emotional outburst from Gabriel. Debt-ridden Jim fears an investigation into illegal goings-on at the greyhound track will expose his own complicity, while the close professional relationship between Jack and Debbie turns personal.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Debbie is assigned a major drugs investigation - much to Phil's irritation and Jim's alarm - but the chance to prove herself takes second place to family concerns when she learns her son has sustained internal bleeding from his fall. The bad news prompts her to hand in her resignation, leaving Jack wondering what the future holds for their relationship. Andrea tells Smithy that Gabriel raped Kerry, whose death continues to take its toll on the renegade copper.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry's father visits Sun Hill to collect his murdered daughter's belongings, reopening old wounds for Smithy who begins to see Gabriel for the manipulative psychopath he is and threatens to officially accuse him of rape. Elsewhere, Gary thinks he's stumbled across a dismembered body - until Suzie points out the grisly remains are actually a collection of prosthetic limbs.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The offer of a substantial reward inspires Hetty to find the bright spark behind a spate of arson attacks, and she begins by investigating the activities of a neighbour's foster daughter whose absences from home coincide with the fires. Housewife-detective series, starring Patricia Routledge, with Derek Benfield and Dominic Monaghan.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The detectives find themselves swamped with work after their recent success. Hetty turns her attention to a troubled village, while Robert and Geoffrey embark on a case of their own. Private eye drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Cinder Path
programme.desc: Drama about one man's journey through love and war in the early part of the century. Charlie MacFell returns from university to the family farm, where his strict father still rules with an iron fist _ a situation that soon changes thanks to a misunderstanding with a foolish farmhand. Lloyd Owen stars, with Catherine Zeta Jones, Tom Bell and Maria Mile.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: American diplomat Ryan Reed is shot dead and the team arrives at the scene to find his body posed - sitting upright on a bench with his hand tucked inside his jacket. An argument quickly ensues between the police and the US embassy, which claims the murder falls under its jurisdiction, while the Lyell crew fights against the bureaucracy of the FBI, aided only by the US deputy chief of mission Matt Garcia. However, when he goes missing, Nikki is concerned he might be the next target.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. The body of a Falklands War veteran who became one of the leading lights in the campaign against nuclear weapons is found in a stretch of river running underneath the Ministry of Defence. As Boyd and the team set about investigating the man's former allies, they stumble upon footage of an incident intelligence services had tried to cover up - and Grace is reunited with a former lover from her own time in the anti-nuclear movement. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe, Into the Storm), John McArdle (Brookside) and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral, Spooks).

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Anna Westin, a troubled childhood friend of Wallander's daughter, visits his house late at night begging for his help - but disappears soon afterwards. Meanwhile, an elderly woman's burned body is found in a shallow grave, and when the detective discovers a connection between Anna and the murder victim, he fears she could be the next target of a dangerous religious fanatic. Linda returns to Ystad to help with the investigation, and has life-changing news for her father. Guest starring Lindsay Duncan (Rome), with Kenneth Branagh and Jeany Spark.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward returns to Barton House in Warwickshire to talk to its owners about the work involved in creating their 12-acre site, which is opening for a few days as part of the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Robert tries to arrange a love-match between Eleanor and one of his old comrades-in-arms, but meets with a conspicuous lack of success. Then a belligerent boxer with head injuries gives him an unexpected helping hand, and medicine starts taking a back seat to romance at the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave, David Calder and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: An army policewoman who bears a grudge against Deborah threatens her life and the team are pushed to the limit on a rigorous training exercise.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Wayne Radford's grave is vandalised and the prime suspect is promptly gunned down, leading Gina to uncover the shocking truth about Irene. Smithy plays a dangerous double game, trying to worm his way into Gabriel's confidence, while simultaneously urging Andrea to spill the beans about the psychotic copper's rape of Kerry - but the undercover reporter soon has other things on her mind when Phil catches her in a passionate embrace with Neil.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Medical drama series charting life on the wards of Holby City Hospital. The casts of Casualty and Holby City unite for this action-packed special which sees the emergency and surgical staff thrown together when a fuel tanker crashes into the hospital.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A pair of twins are both taken ill, and when one dies the other seems set to respond in kind. Baby Louis is almost smothered by his nanny, who exhibits signs of Munchausen's syndrome. Charlie accidentally brushes against a woman, who makes an official complaint accusing him of sexual harassment.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rob probes the circumstances of Jimmy Cross's shooting and learns the truth about his father's murder, sending him on a mission of vengeance that culminates in a tense stand-off. Elsewhere, Abi's kidnapper sends Samantha a macabre message that leads her to an equally sinister website, and Phil taunts Neil over his affair with Andrea.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Tempers are running high at the Taveriers, while Rachel awaits important news about her future.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle, Clyde and Pat believe their jobs at the Queen Vic are under threat, but Sharon is preoccupied wth more personal matters and keeps Grant guessing.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The fire-fighting drama returns. Blue Watch deals with a fire at a hotel which is run as council accommodation. Bayleaf is set up on a date with Clare.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer attempts to sell dodgy prints to a friend of Lady Jane Felsham - only to learn Eric has procured a bronze statue in a house on a pig farm famously stolen from Her Majesty the Queen. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim hunts for sunken treasure that has attracted too much attention from the wrong people while tracking down a crooked property tycoon, and discovers the key to it all lies in an eccentric old woman's past. Beryl Reid guest stars, with John Nettles and Sean Arnold.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: A exploitative photographer suggests Aveline should pose topless - but soon regrets his suggestion. Meanwhile, Jack makes an inauspicious entry into the art world.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: A golf pro teaches Captain Peacock how to swing a club - but in the process strikes a blow on Mrs Slocombe's head that causes her to revert to childhood. Comedy, starring Frank Thornton and Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel moves in with Jean, but each has trouble letting go of their independence. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo are called in to investigate the death of a musically gifted schoolboy whose drugged and drowned body has been found in a canal. For Dalziel, the case forces painful memories to resurface, while Pascoe exposes hidden scandals at the victim's school. Crime drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Sarah Smart and Duncan Preston.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Sasha is occupied with a training course, the boys' investigations take them to a lookalike agency, where their top two acts were found dead in an apparent double suicide 13 years ago. In an industry reliant on the art of the illusion and their suspects intent on giving them the run around, Ted, Steve and Danny are convinced there's more to this case than first meets the eye. Steve is thrilled when their enquiries take them to the door of one of his football heroes, but his glee is short-lived. Detective drama, starring Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The detectives connect the killing of a gypsy woman near Glasgow to a policeman stabbed in London during a jewel robbery, but their inquiries are hampered by a team from the Met.

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Bob Hoskins stars in the first of a lavish two-part adventure based on Arthur Conan Doyle's novel about a British scientific team's 1911 expedition into the uncharted Amazon jungle in search of prehistoric life. Maverick Professor Challenger leads the quest for a mythical plateau, aiming to prove his theory that dinosaurs still roam certain parts of the Earth.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor unwittingly saves the life of a brutal East End villain, who begins terrorising patients and staff alike. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Steve Evans meets a mystery woman and soon realises that she is more closely linked to the army than he would like. Mark finds himself breaking the law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rob probes the circumstances of Jimmy Cross's shooting and learns the truth about his father's murder, sending him on a mission of vengeance that culminates in a tense stand-off. Elsewhere, Abi's kidnapper sends Samantha a macabre message that leads her to an equally sinister website, and Phil taunts Neil over his affair with Andrea.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is sedated in maternity and wakes up to find she cannot remember the tragic events of the previous week. Will's attitude problem causes trouble in the canteen, leading to another run-in with Connie. Jess tells Sean she is not ready to break the news about the baby to her father - but that's the least of her worries after she goes for a scan.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie's colleagues demonstrate their support for him in the sexual harassment case being brought by Mrs O'Donnell, while a local journalist claims to have injured his wrist in a bid to get to the heart of the story.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Celestine tries to reassure Etta about Lloyd, and Sharon is upset about Grant making plans for the future without consulting her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ethel is forced to make a difficult decision, one that has serious consequences for a very close friend.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A new station commander arrives and causes friction in the team as he implements a stricter regime. Meanwhile, a fire is started at a local primary school.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Who Is the Fairest of Them All?
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. However, the object of his affections has some shocking news for him that suggests he may have left matters too late. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Ice maiden Philippa Vale shows up in Jersey just as a large diamond is about to be auctioned - and sure enough, it soon disappears. Liza Goddard guests alongside John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie's sea-faring brother dies, so the Boswells decide it would be fitting to arrange a burial at sea. Carla Lane's comedy, starring Jean Boht and Ronald Forfar.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The store advertises on Citizen Band radio, but unfortunately Mrs Slocombe's attempt to publicise her underwear attracts the attentions of the wrong type of customer. Shop-floor comedy, with Mollie Sugden and featuring the voice of Robbie Coltrane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean opens another secretarial agency, but needs someone to run it. Work for Lionel seems to have dried up, giving her cause for concern. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick High Court Judge's daughter is arrested during a demonstration, presenting him with the challenge of getting her off the hook without falling foul of powerful enemies he has made in his single-minded push to the top of the legal profession. Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden and Caroline Langrishe star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Taggart investigate the murder of a pensioner, focusing their inquiries on his daughter and son-in-law. Unfortunately, the case soon takes an unexpected turn. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Trapped on the plateau, Edward, Agnes and Lord Roxton set out in search of professors Challenger and Summerlee, following their capture by the strange apemen who may provide the missing link between modern man and prehistoric life. But when they mount a rescue, the explorers are confronted by a native tribe. Conclusion of the adventure, starring Bob Hoskins, Peter Falk and James Fox.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: High Streets: End of the Road? Tonight
programme.desc: A report on the downward trend in spending in Britain's high-street stores over the past 10 years. Geraint Vincent follows typical shopping street Dalton Road in Barrow-in-Furness through the crucial festive period and hears from firms facing high rates and tough competition from the internet and retail parks. But to some, high streets are more than just a place of business - they are a crucial part of the community. Geraint also meets those trying to attract more visitors, and explores whether everyone has a responsibility to support town centres.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ross Kemp's report from inside the maximum-security jail takes him to Belmarsh's jail-within-a-jail, where anti-Islamic inmates have to be separated from Islamic prisoners for fear of violence. He also heads to the prison healthcare unit, and meets transgender prisoner Claire Darbyshire, who was given one of the lowest minimum terms for murder in British legal history after killing her father.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the final leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo takes a railway adventure to picturesque Lake Iseo, a hidden gem often overshadowed by its big sisters Garda and Como. He starts out angling for sardines, then takes his catch and prepares a dish of grilled fish for the passengers of Treno dei Sapore - a tourist train that takes guests along the lakeside and into the Franciacorta region. While they enjoy the views they also get a seven-course meal - with today's starter cooked by Gino.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a student from a prestigious all-female college is found dead, Will and Geordie infiltrate the murky world of campus politics and university societies to find the killer. Navigating strange initiations, raucous parties - and with investigative journalist, Ellie Harding, hot on their heels - they need to use every advantage at their disposal to unravel the mystery. Cathy's ambitions for a life of her own start to test the delicate family balance, while fresh from a spell with Daniel in Marrakech, Leonard finds it hard to acclimatise to life back in Grantchester. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Brian McFadden is at the home of pop star and actor Adam Rickitt as he plays host to four strangers in his home. Will Adam avoid the washing up with his cryptic clues as to his identity or will the four diners bag the cash prize and hand the rubber gloves to him?.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the lush Ionian island of Corfu, beginning in its capital, Corfu Town, where she discovers a surprising, cosmopolitan city more like a little slice of Italy than Greece. After sampling the delights of its famous mumquat flavoured ice-cream, a cookery lesson in making signature savoury dish pastitsada reveals the island's centuries-old love affair with exotic spices. Julia meets a pair of brothers passionate about revolutionising production of Corfu's oldest and most important export - olive oil- and ends her stay trying out the secret to staying young that all Corfiots swear by.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.desc: The body of 19-year-old apprentice electrician Dennis Bayliss is discovered washed up on the shore of a North Northumberland rural estate. The victim turns out to be the estranged son of Steph and Rob Bayliss who are left crippled by his death, having lost him once already when he abandoned them to seek out his biological father, Thomas Walken, who just happens to run a salmon farm on the spot where the body was found. Vera is forced to look closer at the strained relationships of Dennis's two families in order to find the truth about his death.

programme.desc: Documentary following workers on the Tyne and Wear Metro - the UK's largest metro system outside of London. In the first edition, staff in Sunderland prepare for the arrival of 50,000 Spice Girls fans ahead of the pop group's concert at the Stadium of Light. The pressure rises across the day as head of operations Wayne spots a potential fault with an overhead line, and there's an anxious call to the control room - a set of fans have lost their tickets for the concert of a lifetime. Narrated by Zoe Hakin.

programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends from Dundee answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Vicky, Dexter, Francesca and Dave, who have never met before, pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Tens of thousands of Newcastle United fans pass through the Metro for a home game on the first day of the new football season - and many of them are far from pleased with the club's owner. A guide horse undergoes training on the Metro system before moving to London, and in Sunderland, a crackdown on fare dodgers gets underway.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A touring dance extravaganza comes to Midsomer, but nobody sees the vicious rivalries and long-running feuds that are brewing behind the scenes - at least not until they erupt into murder. Barnaby's investigation into the killing of a dancer is complicated by an unexpected visit from his father, while the sponsor of the event is at the centre of a conflict of his own as he tries to decide who should inherit his fortune. Guest starring Nigel Havers and Christopher Timothy, as well as former Strictly Come Dancing stars Cassidy Little, Faye Tozer, Danny Mac, Natalie Gumede and Tom Chambers.

credits.actor: as well as former Strictly Come Dancing stars Cassidy Little

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Stan and his number two Mick Clark speak to Jeremy and relatives of the murdered family, but their picture of what really happened at White House Farm remains inconclusive. The twins' father Colin Caffell is devastated by his loss, and is initially comforted by Jeremy, while post-mortem examinations reveal nothing to contradict the murder-suicide theory. Meanwhile, relative Ann Eaton cannot believe Sheila was responsible, and discusses her growing suspicions with her brother David Boutflour.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef travels through France to visit the locations that inspired his culinary career, beginning at the Chateau Cheval Blanc in Saint-Emilion, before going back to the kitchens of the Hostellerie de Plaisance, where he worked as a lad more than 30 years ago. He rounds off his trip by cooking at an award-winning vineyard.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: January sees the fishermen returning to their boats and resupplying for the crab-fishing season.

programme.title: Gold Divers

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Jared and Johnny's epic mission grinds to a halt, Roscoe battles the elements on a world famous rally, and Turbo is flagged down by the police.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Supertruckers

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fleet pushes on despite heavy Arctic storms. The Time Bandit continues with a limited amount of bait, while the Maverick and Rollo dump their pots to stay upright. Meanwhile, tension mounts after the Cornelia Marie stays in Dutch Harbour for three days, with the captain's son eager to take to the seas to earn more money.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Emily Riedel has an experience that teaches her the dangers of dredging, while novice crews and poorly designed vessels cause tempers to flare.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to an antiques shop in Edinburgh on a hunt for new stock, and on an expedition to a 750-year-old house, he discovers an item that takes him out of his comfort zone.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Carl Andrews gets behind the wheel to transport a sizeable load, Russell's mobile classroom is shaken and the Ferrises manage to dodge raging bush fires.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an old Range Rover Mk3 for a bargain price, hoping Edd China can renovate it and have it resprayed white in order to pass it on for double the amount he paid.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Master blacksmith Neville Morris works on a piece of railing that was once a Victorian club fender. Meanwhile, Martin restores a Second World War RAF hero's bomber jacket.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Seeing an untapped source of rare items, Drew Pritchard tours Catalonia looking for some chic Spanish antiques. In Peralada, he is blown away by a 17th-century house full of treasures.

programme.desc: On a trip to Barcelona to buy antiques Drew Pritchard uncovers an early, two-door Range Rover. In Hampshire, he and Paul Cowland disagree on how to restore a Porsche 944.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how New York bagels are hand-rolled, how they make a racing car tyre that will grip the track at 320kph, and how life-like sculptures are created out of glass.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how waste is collected in Venice, how Australia's famous sheepskin boots are made, and how pond algae is turned into a health supplement.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Porsche Boxster for 1,000 - despite it having seized brakes and mould on its roof. Expert mechanic Edd China tries to determine the cause of the faults so the pair can make the necessary repairs and trade it on at a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini decides to buy a 1956 Porsche 356 Cabriolet on the recommendation of a friend.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
